conclusion: Apply Newton's laws of motion and principles of static equilibrium.
Object A is at rest with mass 5 kg.
Gravity on object A is 50 N.
Tensions in ropes O, A, and B are TO, TA, and TB respectively.
Object B is at rest with mass 10 kg.
Gravity on object B is 100 N.
Tensions in ropes O, A, and B are TO, TA, and TB respectively.
Rope O is horizontal and makes a 45-degree angle with the vertical.
Tension in rope O is TO.
Rope A is attached to block A and is horizontal.
Tension in rope A is TA.
Rope B is attached to block B and is horizontal.
Tension in rope B is TB.
Calculate tension in rope O using gravitational force component.
Gravitational force on object A is mg.
Tension in rope O is TO = mg cos 45°.
Cosine of 45° is √2/2.
Calculate tension in rope A using gravitational force component.
Gravitational force on object A is mg.
Tension in rope A is TA = mg sin 45°.
Sine of 45° is √2/2.
Calculate tension in rope B using gravitational force component.
Gravitational force on object B is mg.
Tension in rope B is TB = mg cos 45°.
